FIG. 25 is a block diagram of an example processing system 2500 capable of implementing the apparatus and methods disclosed herein. The processing system 2500 can be, for example, a server, a personal computer, a personal digital assistant (PDA), an Internet appliance, or any other type of computing device.

The system 2500 of the instant example includes a processor 2512 such as a general purpose programmable processor. The processor 2512 includes a local memory 2514, and executes coded instructions 2516 present in the local memory 2514 and/or in another memory device. The processor 2512 may execute, among other things, machine readable instructions to implement the processes represented in FIGS. 7-24. The processor 2512 may be any type of processing unit, such as one or more microprocessors from any microprocessor family or families, one or more microcontrollers from any microcontroller family or families, etc., or any combination thereof.

The processor 2512 is in communication with a main memory including a volatile memory 2518 and a non-volatile memory 2520 via a bus 2522. The volatile memory 2518 may be implemented by Static Random Access Memory (SRAM), Synchronous Dynamic Random Access Memory (SDRAM), Dynamic Random Access Memory (DRAM), RAMBUS Dynamic Random Access Memory (RDRAM) and/or any other type of random access memory device. The non-volatile memory 2520 may be implemented by flash memory and/or any other desired type of memory device. Access to the main memory 2518, 2520 is typically controlled by a memory controller (not shown).

The processing system 2500 also includes an interface circuit 2524. The interface circuit 2524 may be implemented by any type of interface standard, such as an Ethernet interface, a universal serial bus (USB), and/or a third generation input/output (3GIO) interface.

One or more input devices 2526 are connected to the interface circuit 2524. The input device(s) 2526 permit a user to enter data and commands into the processor 2512. The input device(s) can be implemented by, for example, a keyboard, a mouse, a touchscreen, a track-pad, a trackball, an isopoint and/or a voice recognition system.

One or more output devices 2528 are also connected to the interface circuit 2524. The output devices 2528 can be implemented, for example, by display devices (e.g., a liquid crystal display, a cathode ray tube display (CRT)), by a printer and/or by speakers. The interface circuit 2524, thus, typically includes a graphics driver card.

The interface circuit 2524 also includes a communication device such as a modem or network interface card to facilitate exchange of data with external computers via a network (e.g., an Ethernet connection, a digital subscriber line (DSL), a telephone line, coaxial cable, a cellular telephone system, etc.).

The processing system 2500 also includes one or more mass storage devices 2530 for storing machine readable instructions and data. Examples of such mass storage devices 2530 include floppy disk drives, hard drive disks, compact disk drives and digital versatile disk (DVD) drives.

The coded instructions 2532 of FIGS. 7-24 may be stored in the mass storage device 2530, in the volatile memory 2518, in the non-volatile memory 2520, in the local memory 2514 and/or on a removable storage medium, such as a CD or DVD 2532.

As an alternative to implementing the methods and/or apparatus described herein in a system such as the processing system of FIG. 25, the methods and or apparatus described herein may be embedded in a structure such as a processor and/or an ASIC (application specific integrated circuit).

Finally, although certain example methods, apparatus and articles of manufacture have been described herein, the scope of coverage of this patent is not limited thereto. On the contrary, this patent covers all methods, apparatus and articles of manufacture fairly falling within the scope of the appended claims either literally or under the doctrine of equivalents.
Further methods, apparatus and articles of manufacture in accordance with the examples disclosed herein are defined in the following numbered clauses:

Numbered Clause 1. A method to report link quality measurements for downlink dual carrier operation, the method comprising:
determining whether all valid per slot link quality measurements can be included in a reporting message; and
dependent on at least in part that all the valid per slot link quality measurements cannot be included in the reporting message, including in the reporting message a subset of the valid per slot link quality measurements and of overall link quality measurements in accordance with a prioritization scheme.

Numbered Clause 2. A method as defined in numbered clause 1 wherein the valid per slot link quality measurements correspond to timeslots on a particular carrier for which link quality measurements have been requested.

Numbered Clause 3. A method as defined in numbered clauses 1 or 2 wherein including in the reporting message the subset of the valid per slot link quality measurements and of the overall link quality measurements in accordance with the prioritization scheme comprises:
including in the reporting message the valid per slot link quality measurements; and
dependent on at least in part that the overall link quality measurements for a carrier include a plurality of overall bit error probabilities corresponding respectively to a plurality of different modulation types, including in the reporting message the overall bit error probability for only one of the plurality of different modulation types.

Numbered Clause 4. A method as defined in numbered clauses 1 or 2 wherein including in the reporting message the subset of the valid per slot link quality measurements and of the overall link quality measurements in accordance with the prioritization scheme comprises:
including in the reporting message the valid per slot link quality measurements; and
dependent on at least in part that the overall link quality measurements for a carrier include one or more overall bit error probabilities corresponding respectively to different modulation types, omitting all of the one or more overall bit error probabilities for the carrier from the reporting message.

Numbered Clause 5. A method as defined in numbered clauses 1 or 2 wherein including in the reporting message the subset of the valid per slot link quality measurements and of the overall link quality measurements in accordance with the prioritization scheme comprises:
including in the reporting message the valid per slot link quality measurements; and
alternating over consecutive reporting messages each carrier for which overall bit error probabilities are to be included , the overall bit error probabilities for a particular carrier corresponding to different modulation types used on the particular carrier.

Numbered Clause 6. A method as defined in numbered clauses 1 or 2 wherein including in the reporting message the subset of the valid per slot link quality measurements and of the overall link quality measurements in accordance with the prioritization scheme comprises:
including in the reporting message the valid per slot link quality measurements; and
alternating over consecutive reporting messages inclusion of overall bit error probabilities for each of a plurality of modulation types used on a particular carrier.

Numbered Clause 7. A method as defined in numbered clauses 1 or 2 wherein including in the reporting message the subset of the valid per slot link quality measurements and of the overall link quality measurements in accordance with the prioritization scheme comprises:
including in the reporting message all overall bit error probabilities for a first carrier and a carrier, the overall bit error probabilities for a particular carrier corresponding to different modulation types used on the particular carrier; and
including in the reporting message a subset of the valid per slot link quality measurements.
Numbered Clause 8. A method as defined in any one of numbered clauses 1 to 7 wherein the valid per slot link quality measurements comprise per slot mean bit error probability measurements.
Numbered Clause 9. A method as defined in any one of numbered clauses 1 to 7 wherein the valid per slot link quality measurements comprise per slot interference measurements.
Numbered Clause 10. A method as defined in any one of numbered clauses 1 to 7 wherein the reporting message is a packet downlink ack/nack message.

Numbered Clause 11. A method to report link quality measurements for downlink dual carrier operation, the method comprising:
determining whether link quality measurements to be reported for downlink dual carrier operation include valid per slot bit error probability measurements and valid per slot interference measurements; and
dependent on at least in part that the link quality measurements to be reported include valid per slot bit error probability measurements and valid per slot interference measurements, including in a reporting message a combination of the valid per slot bit error probability measurements and the valid per slot interference measurements in accordance with a prioritization scheme.

Numbered Clause 12. A method as defined in numbered clause 11 wherein including in the reporting message the combination of the valid per slot bit error probability measurements and the valid per slot interference measurements in accordance with a prioritization scheme comprises:
including the valid per slot bit error probability measurements in the reporting message;
dependent on at least in part that available space remains in the reporting message, including one or more valid per slot interference measurements able to fit in the available space; and
dependent on at least in part that available space does not remain in the reporting message, omitting reporting of one or more valid interference measurements.

Numbered Clause 13. A method as defined in numbered clause 11 wherein including in the reporting message the combination of the valid per slot bit error probability measurements and the valid per slot interference measurements in accordance with a prioritization scheme comprises:
including the valid per slot bit error probability measurements in the reporting message; and
dependent on at least in part that all valid per slot interference measurements for a particular carrier supporting dual carrier operation do not fit in available space of the reporting message, omitting reporting of the valid pet slot interference measurements for the particular carrier.

Numbered Clause 14. A method as defined in numbered clause 11 wherein including in the reporting message the combination of the valid per slot bit error probability measurements and the valid per slot interference measurements in accordance with a prioritization scheme comprises alternating between including the per slot bit error probability measurements and including the valid per slot interference measurements in consecutive reporting messages.

Numbered Clause 15. A method as defined in numbered clause 11 wherein including in the reporting message the combination of the valid per slot bit error probability measurements and the valid per slot interference measurements in accordance with a prioritization scheme comprises alternating over consecutive reporting messages inclusion of the per slot bit error probability measurements and per slot interference measurements for different carriers.
Numbered Clause 16. A method as defined in any one of numbered clauses 11 to 15 wherein the reporting message is a packet downlink ack/nack message.

Numbered Clause 17. A method to report link quality measurements for downlink dual carrier operation, the method comprising:
receiving a reporting message from a mobile station in response to a request for per slot link quality measurements for a carrier; and
obtaining from the reporting message a subset of the requested per slot link quality measurements and of overall link quality measurements for the carrier, the subset of the requested per slot link quality measurements and of the overall link quality measurements for the carrier included in the reporting message in accordance with a prioritization scheme.

Numbered Clause 18. A method as defined in numbered clause 17 wherein the subset of the requested per slot link quality measurements and of the overall link quality measurements includes:
the requested per slot link quality measurements; and
an overall bit error probability for only one of a plurality of different modulation types used on the particular carrier.

Numbered Clause 19. A method as defined in numbered clause 17 wherein the subset of the requested per slot link quality measurements and of the overall link quality measurements includes the requested per slot link quality measurements, but does not include overall bit error probabilities for the carrier although the overall link quality measurements for the carrier are to include one or more overall bit error probabilities.

Numbered Clause 20. A method as defined in numbered clause 17 wherein the subset of the requested per slot link quality measurements and of the overall link quality measurements includes:
the requested per slot link quality measurements; and
overall bit error probabilities for one of two carriers, consecutive reporting messages to alternate between carriers for which overall bit error probabilities are to be reported, the overall bit error probabilities for a particular carrier corresponding to different modulation types used on the particular carrier.

Numbered Clause 21. A method as defined in numbered clause 17 wherein the subset of the requested per slot link quality measurements and of the overall link quality measurements includes:
the requested per slot link quality measurements; and
an overall bit error probability for one modulation type used on a particular carrier, consecutive reporting messages to alternate between modulation types for which overall bit error probabilities are to be reported for the particular carrier.

Numbered Clause 22. A method as defined in numbered clause 17 wherein the subset of the requested per slot link quality measurements and of the overall link quality measurements includes:
all overall bit error probabilities for a first carrier and a second carrier, the overall bit error probabilities for a particular carrier corresponding to different modulation types used on the particular carrier; and
a subset of the requested per slot link quality measurements.
Numbered Clause 23. A method as defined in any one of numbered clauses 17 to 22 wherein the requested per slot link quality measurements comprise per slot mean bit error probability measurements.
Numbered Clause 24. A method as defined in any one of numbered clauses 17 to 22 wherein the requested per slot link quality measurements comprise per slot interference measurements.
Numbered Clause 25. A method as defined in any one of numbered clauses 17 to 22 wherein the reporting message is a packet downlink ack/nack message.

Numbered Clause 26. A method to report link quality measurements for downlink dual carrier operation, the method comprising:
receiving a reporting message from a mobile station in response to a request for per slot bit error probability measurements and requested per slot interference measurements for downlink dual carrier operation; and
obtaining from the reporting message a combination of the requested per slot bit error probability measurements and the requested per slot interference measurements, the combination of the requested per slot bit error probability measurements and the requested per slot interference measurements included in the reporting message in accordance with a prioritization scheme.

Numbered Clause 27. A method as defined in numbered clause 26 wherein the combination of the requested per slot bit error probability measurements and the requested per slot interference measurements includes:
the requested per slot bit error probability measurements; and
a subset of the requested per slot interference measurements that are able to fit in the reporting message after the requested per slot bit error probability measurements are included in the reporting message.

Numbered Clause 28. A method as defined in numbered clause 26 wherein the combination of the requested per slot bit error probability measurements and the requested per slot interference measurements includes:
the requested per slot bit error probability measurements in the reporting message; and
none of the requested per slot interference measurements for a particular carrier.

Numbered Clause 29. A method as defined in numbered clause 26 wherein the combination of the requested per slot bit error probability measurements and the requested per slot interference measurements includes one of the requested per slot bit error probability measurements or the requested per slot interference measurements, consecutive reporting messages to alternate between including the per slot bit error probability measurements and including the requested per slot interference measurements.

Numbered Clause 30. A method as defined in numbered clause 26 wherein the combination of the requested per slot bit error probability measurements and the requested per slot interference measurements includes per slot bit error probability measurements and per slot interference measurements for a particular carrier, consecutive reporting messages to alternate between each of two carriers for which per slot bit error probability measurements and per slot interference measurements are to be reported
Numbered Clause 31. A method as defined in any one of numbered clauses 26 to 30 wherein the reporting message is a packet downlink ack/nack message.
Numbered Clause 32. An article of manufacture storing machine readable instructions which, when executed, cause a machine to perform the method defined in any one of numbered clauses 1 to 31.
Numbered Clause 33. An apparatus comprising a processor configured to perform the method defined in any one of numbered clauses 1 to 31.

claim.claim-text: A method to report link quality measurements for multiple downlink carriers operation, the method comprising: determining whether link quality measurements configured to be reported include both per slot bit error probability measurements and per slot interference measurements; and dependent on at least in part that the link quality measurements to be reported include both per slot bit error probability measurements and per slot interference measurements, including in a reporting message a subset of the per slot bit error probability measurements and the per slot interference measurements in accordance with a prioritization scheme.

A method as defined in claim 1, further comprising: dependent on at least in part that the link quality measurements configured to be reported include both the per slot bit error probability measurements and the per slot interference measurements, and further dependent on at least in part that available space does not allow inclusion of all the per slot bit error probability measurements and the per slot interference measurements for multiple downlink carriers in at most two reporting message instances, including in the at most two reporting message instances a subset of the per slot bit error probability measurements and the per slot interference measurements in accordance with the prioritization scheme.

A method as defined in claim 2, wherein including in the at most two reporting message instances the subset of the per slot bit error probability measurements and the per slot interference measurements in accordance with the prioritization scheme comprises: including all the per slot bit error probability measurements in each reporting message instance; including in the at most two reporting message instances one or more of the per slot interference measurements able to fit in the available space of the at most two reporting message instances; and omitting reporting of one or more of the per slot interference measurements in the at most two reporting message instances.

A method as defined in claim 2, wherein including in the at most two reporting message instances the subset of the per slot bit error probability measurements and the per slot interference measurements in accordance with the prioritization scheme comprises: including all the per slot bit error probability measurements in the reporting message; and including a first subset of the per slot interference measurements in the at most two reporting message instances and including a different second subset of the per slot interference measurements in subsequent reporting message instances.

A method as defined in claim 1, wherein including in the reporting message the subset of the per slot bit error probability measurements and the per slot interference measurements in accordance with a prioritization scheme comprises: including the per slot bit error probability measurements in the reporting message; dependent on at least in part that available space remains in the reporting message, including one or more of the per slot interference measurements able to fit in the available space; and dependent on at least in part that available space does not remain in the reporting message, omitting reporting of one or more of the per slot interference measurements.
A method as defined in any one of claims 1 to 5, wherein a valid interference measurement for each timeslot on each carrier is not included in at least every other reporting message.

A method as defined in claim 1, wherein including in the reporting message the subset of the per slot bit error probability measurements and the per slot interference measurements in accordance with the prioritization scheme comprises: including the valid per slot bit error probability measurements in the reporting message; and dependent on at least in part that all valid per slot interference measurements for a particular carrier supporting dual carrier operation do not fit in available space of the reporting message, omitting reporting of the valid pet slot interference measurements for the particular carrier.

A method as defined in claim 1, wherein including in the reporting message the subset of the per slot bit error probability measurements and the per slot interference measurements in accordance with the prioritization scheme comprises alternating between including the per slot bit error probability measurements and including the per slot interference measurements in consecutive reporting messages.

A method as defined in claim 1, wherein including in the reporting message the subset of the per slot bit error probability measurements and the per slot interference measurements in accordance with the prioritization scheme comprises alternating over consecutive reporting messages inclusion of the per slot bit error probability measurements and the per slot interference measurements for different carriers.
A method as defined in any one of claims 1 to 9, wherein the per slot bit error probability measurements are bit error probability measurements for assigned downlink timeslots.
A method as defined in any one of claims 1 to 10, wherein the per slot interference measurements are available interference measurements.
A method as defined in any one of claims 1 to 11, wherein the reporting message is a packet downlink ack/nack message.
An article of manufacture storing machine readable instructions which, when executed, cause a machine to perform the method defined in any one of claims 1 to 12.
An apparatus comprising a processor configured to perform the method defined in any one of claims 1 to 12.
